name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica Today, Asian American and Native American Pacific Islander-Serving Institutions serve over 40% of AAPI students. name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica I’ll start by making college more affordable for all by providing free or subsidized tuition for 90% of Americans. I will also cancel debt for borrowers who went to for-profit programs that did not meet standards. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica Between 2016 and 2017, the number of hate crime victims doubled in the Native Hawaiian community and tripled in the Sikh American community. We’re going to invest an additional $1 billion to help law enforcement agencies track and combat hate crimes. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica When I am President, we’ll bring people together to finally pass common-sense gun reforms that most Americans support. That means universal background checks, an assault weapons ban, and red flag laws to prevent individuals who are a threat to themselves or others. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica Our immigration enforcement system is broken. We must expand our resources and compassion for asylum seekers, refugees, and victims of crimes like human trafficking. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica We need to reduce the family-based visa backlog, increase the number of family reunification visas, and eliminate discriminatory per-country caps. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica Immigration is central to the American story. It’s time to reverse the cruel, counterproductive policies of this administration, welcome immigrants to our shores, and make sure that they can access every opportunity our country offers. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica The United States at its best has always been a beacon of opportunity for people around the world. It’s this hope for excellence and opportunity that brought my father to America. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica My administration will also develop a National Health Equity Strategy, which will ensure equal access to quality health care across language barriers, and expand investments in dual language programs for students. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica The 1964 Civil Rights Act promised equal access to federally funded programs for Americans who speak primary languages other than English. It’s time that we fulfill that promise. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica To lift up low-income AAPI communities we will empower workers and raise the minimum wage to $15, invest $10 billion to support small business owners and entrepreneurs from underrepresented backgrounds, and create 3 million more jobs in underserved communities. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica In health care, this means increasing investments to research health disparities for AAPI communities and ensuring that all research programs report disaggregated data. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica To dismantle the barriers that AAPIs face, we have to understand the specific challenges each distinct AAPI community and individual faces. In education, this means collecting disaggregated data on teacher hiring, student outcomes, and the student experience. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica From the Marshallese Americans in Iowa seeking belonging in a new community to Hawaiians striving to preserve their cultural identity, NHPI Americans are critical to our nation's story and we need to lift their voices to shape our policies. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica First off, we need to stop treating the AAPI community like some kind of monolith. They’re anything but. That’s why I prioritize working with AAPI leaders with backgrounds and experiences in all communities. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica One-third of our policy team is AAPI and my administration will recruit AAPI leaders at all levels—not just to shape decisions specific to their communities, but all decisions of national importance. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: @NBCAsianAmerica Asian American & Pacific Islanders have been core to our nation's strength yet have faced a history of exclusion—from the Chinese Exclusion Act to Japanese internment. We often overlook that legacy, in part because the community is not given a voice. That must end. #AAPI2020

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We can say to a Dreamer lying awake at night, questioning if this country is her own, that this country is your country too.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We can tell an autoworker buffeted by tectonic shifts in our economy—that yes our economic future has a place for you, and we need you in it.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We can say to a young woman in a headscarf enduring racial taunts, to a young man feeling fear instead of safety when he spots the lights of a police vehicle—you belong securely in the heart of the American project

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Together we will deliver a democracy worthy of the name. No more manipulated districts, no more dollars outvoting people. And—whether that’s the Black vote in Georgia, the Native vote in North Dakota, or the student vote here in New Hampshire—no more voter suppression.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Together we will deliver the day where your race has no bearing on your health, your wealth, your access to education, or your experience with law enforcement.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Together we will stop sending our young people into the teeth of endless wars and start recruiting every American in the fight for our climate future.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Together we will stop enabling corporate greed and start raising wages; empowering workers and making good on the idea that one job should be enough.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Together we are building a future in which there is no such thing as an uninsured American or an unaffordable prescription.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: This is the powerful majority we’re gathering together—it is a coalition of addition and not subtraction. A movement reaching into church basements and barbershops, into universities and union halls, carrying the same values everywhere we go.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: A fresh outlook is what makes new beginnings possible. And election after election has shown us that putting forward a new perspective is how Democrats win the White House.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: To win and to govern, we need to bring new voices to our capital. We need to get Washington working more like our best run cities and towns, rather than the other way around.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We also know that we can’t defeat such disruptive president by relying on the same Washington framework and mindset.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We’re not going to defeat the most divisive president in modern history by tearing down anyone who doesn’t agree with us 100 percent of the time.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: My competitors and I share the same fundamental goals—bringing balance to our economy, guaranteeing health care to every American, combating a climate crisis and a rising tide of gun violence. But we do differ in what we believe it will take to make that happen.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: When a Commander-in-Chief pardons war criminals and punishes war heroes, while systematically demolishing the credibility of our country in the eyes of the world—we dare not risk four more years of this presidency—we must get this right.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: When people of color fear for their own place in their own country, while infants are torn from their parents at the border—we must get this right.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: When Americans live under an unaccountable president who will cut taxes for corporations and then cut Medicare, Medicaid, and Social Security for the rest of us—we must get this right.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We go forward knowing that this is our chance—our only chance—not just to end the era of Donald Trump, but to launch the era that must come next.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: And if our campaign moves you, I hope you’ll go to  https://t.co/B4NhVya8m6 and contribute what you can.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We go forward fueled by hundreds of thousands of grassroots supporters—from the woman in Minnesota who donated in honor of the wife she lost to lung cancer, to the veteran from Connecticut who sent $19.68, in honor of the year he served in Vietnam. This campaign belongs to them.

name: Pete Buttigieg

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: This is the most consequential election of our lifetimes. The next president will come into office at a moment of profound change. We cannot afford to relive old arguments, recycle old approaches, or return to the political warfare we have come to accept from Washington, DC.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: From coastal cities to rural and industrial communities like mine, we are one nation. We are all at risk of a changing climate, an evolving economy, an unchecked gun lobby, politicians who put party before country, a president who divides us while putting himself above the law.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: No region of our country is immune to the threats we face. A gig worker in California is struggling with the same tectonic shifts in our economy as a driver in South Bend or a nurse in South Carolina. An Iowa farmer fears the costs of climate change as much as a student in NY.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: I stand with these @UNITEHERE_SoFla members as they strike for the fair wages and benefits they deserve. As president, I will work to make sure all American workers are able to pay their bills and provide health care to their families.

name: Pete Buttigieg

name: Pete Buttigieg

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: If we don’t act now, it could take 200 years for the gap to close for all women.  It’s time to break with the past and build lasting power for all women in America—that means closing the gap and tackling the injustices that go beyond equal pay.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: On this day in 2009, President Obama took an important step forward by signing the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act, giving women the power to right past wrongs. But 11 years later, women are still earning less for equal work.  It's 2020. That's unacceptable.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Women make up half the American workforce. But across the board—from CEOs to first responders—women are not paid equally for the work they do.  On average, women are paid 83 cents for each dollar paid to a white man. For Black women, it falls to 62 cents. For Latinas, it’s 52.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We’ll make disaster preparedness efforts inclusive and help ensure that, after a disaster, people with disabilities can return to their homes and communities.  We’ll develop an Accessible Technology Bill of Rights and make the voting process accessible to everyone. #CripTheVote

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Our plan will end the subminimum wage and double labor force participation of people with disabilities by 2030. We'll make inclusive education a national expectation and fully fund IDEA. We’ll end the SSDI benefit cliff and increase accessible public housing and transportation.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: I worked with our disability policy team—led by people with disabilities—to develop our plan with extensive input from disability leaders and stakeholders with different backgrounds.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: My plans strengthen rights and supports for people with disabilities—since all issues impact this community. My plan is intersectional, recognizing how disability is visible and invisible, how the challenges are urgent, and how we must combat disparities:  https://t.co/EVhrpZ5w6J

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Breaking down these barriers is incredibly urgent. We need both bold, massive shifts in federal policies and a national effort to create a more inclusive, accessible, and welcoming society. #CripTheVote

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: It’s unacceptable that in almost 20 states, parents diagnosed with a disability can lose custody of their kids. It’s unacceptable that hundreds of thousands lack accessible transportation. Decades-old programs and policies have kept people with disabilities on the margins.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: For too long, society has built up physical and invisible obstacles for people with disabilities, and the disability community is tired.  Tired of not having their voices heard.  Tired of being their own strongest advocates.  Tired of struggling for their own basic access.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: I’ve been committed to an accessible, inclusive campaign—from our staff and volunteers to folks I meet every day—that reflects the culture of belonging I want for our country. We developed our plan with many diverse leaders from the disability community. #CripTheVote

tweet: If you’re watching the #DemDebate and feel exhausted by the spectacle of division and dysfunction, this is our chance. Join me.   If you’re sick of hearing that the economy is so great when it doesn’t match your experience at the kitchen table, join me.   We can turn the page.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: This is our moment. We have exactly one shot.  We have one shot to defeat Donald Trump, and to do it so resoundingly that we send Trumpism into the dustbin of history.   But there is a risk—and that risk is to turn to the same Washington political warfare that we’re used to.

name: Pete Buttigieg

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: The #DemDebate is about to start. Before I go, I’m handing my accounts over to my team in South Bend. They’ll tweet for me throughout the night—make sure you’re following us on @Instagram, @Snapchat, and @Facebook too.  I hope to make you proud. Let’s do this.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: To the more than 733,000 people who have joined our movement so far, thank you. We would not be here without you. To all who will join tonight and in the coming months, thank you too.  We’re building this movement together—let’s keep it going:  https://t.co/qFOcd8NxtL #DemDebate

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We didn’t launch @PeteForAmerica with a big email list or a big bank account. But we had hope. We had determination. And we had a belief that solving our nation’s most urgent challenges would require Americans rallying together to tackle them in unity. #DemDebate

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Nearly a year ago, I announced I was exploring a run for president.  Now, we’re just 20 days away from the Iowa Caucuses, and tonight I’ll take the #DemDebate stage for the last time before Iowans make their voices heard.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Thanks to @TheMandyMoore for hitting the campaign trail with me yesterday, and to all who joined us in Ames ahead of tonight’s #DemDebate.  I’m truly grateful for your support. If you’re with us, please chip in:  https://t.co/eoo6H4e9LB  https://t.co/zQnJCMI26v

tweet: .@CoryBooker joined this race knowing that progress is only possible when we rise together.  From fighting for criminal justice reform to championing Baby Bonds, he leads with compassion and conviction—I look forward to working with him to meet our challenges with common purpose.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: I’m out on the road every day meeting folks across this country who believe America’s best days are still ahead.   These next 21 are important for the future of our country, and every dollar will count. If you can, please chip in:  https://t.co/20wb9nSjl0  https://t.co/a1L5VbCfqe

tweet: By the people, for the people.  https://t.co/FgsoWCVYXo

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We are going to be a better country when the economy actually works for all of us.  As president, I will put the focus on you and your family—not giant corporations and the wealthiest. My friend @Austan_Goolsbee explains how.  https://t.co/o1kDgtHnbt

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: American progress is grounded in the idea that every generation will be better off than the last. Every parent's dream is that their kids will be better off than they were.   This is the first generation where that isn't happening—I'm running to change that and put workers first.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: It was great to be back in Nevada yesterday.  From the empowered workers at the @Culinary226 town hall, to the hundreds of people who energized our rally in Las Vegas—and everyone I met in between—thank you for such a warm welcome. Be back soon.  https://t.co/Fvh0faInDQ

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Congratulations to the people of Taiwan on successful elections, and to President Tsai on her reelection.  Taiwan faces direct and growing challenges to its democracy and security. The U.S. must remain strong and firm in our shared commitment to freedom and human dignity.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Congressman Loebsack has never let the political fighting in Washington get in the way of delivering on the priorities of Iowans.  I’m honored to have his endorsement—and look forward to working with him to deliver for the American people.  Welcome to the team, Congressman!

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: I just got off the stage in Las Vegas. The energy and optimism here is inspiring.  If you’re ready to keep building this movement with us, please chip in:  https://t.co/PEcacUVwL6  https://t.co/yHQSKJw8z1

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Jerry Holliman put his life on the line for our country. Now, America is failing him.  As president, I will honor the sacrifices of our service members and ensure all veterans can access the care they need and deserve:  https://t.co/bnlTJ2wWo2    https://t.co/f4UCy32RWF

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: From the water we drink, to the air we breathe, to the roads and public transit we take to work—infrastructure is an important part of our lives, our economy, and our country.   As president, I will invest in the projects we need and fix what needs fixing:  https://t.co/Rbj6nsCQQB  https://t.co/YeMdyKOeW8

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: As president, I won’t measure success by the heights of the Dow Jones, I will measure it by how much a worker has in her pocket. And I will take unprecedented steps to bring balance back to our economy—so that our government looks out for families and not just corporations.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Thank you, @ElissaSlotkin, for taking the lead to reassert Congress’s war powers and for beginning a critical debate on matters of war and peace—just as the Constitution provides.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: When service members are deploying into harm’s way, the president should be prepared to make a case for why they need to be there, and Congress should have the courage to cast a vote on it.   It’s their duty.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Infrastructure is essential to our daily lives. But right now we’re seeing crumbling roads, polluted water, and communities hit by natural disasters. It’s time we invest where we need it.  Today, I’m announcing a plan to build America for the 21st century.  https://t.co/N29oNOW1uK

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Thank you for your service and support, Congressman.   Together, we’ll work to heal our nation’s divides and restore decency and respect to the presidency—so that we can get to work on the urgent issues facing our country.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Innocent civilians are now dead because they were caught in the middle of an unnecessary and unwanted military tit for tat.   My thoughts are with the families and loved ones of all 176 souls lost aboard this flight.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: The world needs an America ready to reverse the rise of authoritarianism while supporting democracy at home and among our allies.  It needs America to be the best it’s ever been, and now it falls to us to set the future of our nation.  Let us choose well.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: The world needs America. But not just any America.  It needs an America free from entrapment in endless war and prepared to focus on future threats.  It needs an America that doesn’t send troops into conflict without a clear understanding of what will come after.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Every cup of coffee, every handshake, and every conversation counts.  https://t.co/VTdE4CcVUb

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: It’s time we choose to hold the most fortunate accountable and invest in the things that have made our country great.   Together, we can usher in a new era that values fairness as well as growth.  https://t.co/DGrlMCIEMw

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Tonight, Americans in Iraq are under fire.  My prayers are with them, their loved ones, and their families.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Attacking cultural monuments in Iran would be a war crime under international laws. We are a nation of laws. We will act to keep America safe, not destroy cultural sites like the Taliban and ISIS have done. And my administration’s orders will not put our troops in legal jeopardy.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Tras los terremotos de anoche, mis pensamientos están con Puerto Rico. A medida que se levantan para superar otra tragedia, los puertorriqueños deben estar asegurados de que esta administración actuará rápidamente para proporcionar cualquier apoyo federal que sea necesario.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: My thoughts are with our fellow citizens in Puerto Rico in the wake of last night’s earthquakes. As they rise to overcome another tragedy, Puerto Ricans must be assured that this administration will act quickly to provide any federal support needed.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: America is stronger when everyone has access to jobs, education, housing, and health care—including those with records. That's why I acted to “ban the box” in South Bend, and it’s why I support Mayor @QuentinHart leading on this issue in Waterloo.   https://t.co/GDySZBneGl

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: On Thursday, I shared a focused approach that will help New Hampshire ensure clean drinking water, build a clean economy, invest in climate security, and support sustainable agriculture.  Read my full plan to galvanize Americans to combat climate change.  https://t.co/4KFD800NKq

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Americans from Portsmouth, NH to South Bend are experiencing the consequences of climate change. Health issues from air pollution, heat, and infectious diseases are growing. Extreme weather conditions are impacting farms, small businesses, homes, and towns. We cannot wait to act.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Climate change is an issue on everyone's mind. Over the weekend, I heard from New Hampshire voters about their growing concerns with changing weather patterns, obstacles to building resilient communities, and this president’s unwillingness to address the climate crisis.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We spent the weekend in the Granite State, meeting with voters and holding town halls in Portsmouth, Nashua, Claremont, Wolfeboro, Franklin, North Conway, Keene, and Manchester.  36 days until New Hampshire’s first-in-the-nation primary!  https://t.co/hqHkSnyZ6I

tweet: When I am Commander-in-Chief, military action will not come as a surprise to congressional leaders of either party.  https://t.co/F9bDP0ZG8n

tweet: Climate change is an existential threat that is affecting everyone, everywhere. My thoughts are with the people of Australia as they battle catastrophic wildfires that have already claimed at least 25 lives.  Here are ways you can help.  https://t.co/4S8l4uh7KR

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: The illegitimate takeover of the Venezuelan National Assembly is further evidence that dictator Maduro will stop at nothing to consolidate his grip on power. I stand behind Juan Guaidó and the Venezuelan people as they strive to reclaim their democracy and defend their rights.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: We still don't know much about the president’s decision-making on Suleimani. But we do know that military efforts to defeat ISIS are now on hold. We know that Iraq's parliament voted to expel U.S. troops. We know that our embassy in Iraq remains under fire.  We are not safer.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: The rise of anti-Semitism in America does not just affect the Jewish community—it affects our whole country.  I stand in solidarity with all those marching in response to recent attacks. We must unite against this scourge and build a nation where all are safe and all belong.

tweet: When I am your Commander-in-Chief, our allies and adversaries will know that the United States is a country that keeps its word.  https://t.co/ROEYgI5hkh

tweet: God does not belong to a political party.

tweet: I'm in New Hampshire where I addressed the events unfolding in the Middle East.  This must not be the beginning of another endless war.  https://t.co/WMzybRgVh4

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: Each one of these service members took an oath to support and defend the Constitution. So did their Commander-in-Chief. He owes them a strategy and he owes the American people answers.

tweet: America is better because @JulianCastro has dedicated his career to lifting communities and expanding opportunities for all of us. I know he will continue to fight for an America where all belong—and we are thankful for his service.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: America's leaders can no longer watch in silence as Assad and Russia attack innocent Idlib civilians. Inaction is a stain on our collective conscience. The international community must use all available tools at its disposal to stop this massacre and provide humanitarian aid.

name: Pete Buttigieg
tweet: In 2020, we say enough of the chaos and corruption. Enough of systems benefiting corporations instead of everyday people. Enough of Washington dysfunction and division. tweet: Together, we brought back a city which was written off as ”dying,” and acted to create new jobs, opportunity, and hope. There’s more to do, but the progress we made tells a story of what we can do by bringing people together around bold ideas.  https://t.co/gCKMK9gxCG
